definitions.definition: A traditional story which embodies a belief regarding some fact or phenomenon of experience, and in which often the forces of nature and of the soul are personified ; a sacred narrative regarding a god , a hero, the origin of the world or of a people, etc.
A commonly-held but false belief , a common misconception ; a fictitious or imaginary person or thing; a popular conception about a real person or event which exaggerates or idealizes reality.
examples: Scientists debunk the myth that gum stays in the human stomach for seven years.

definitions.definition: A person or thing held in excessive or quasi-religious awe or admiration based on popular legend
A person or thing existing only in imagination, or whose actual existence is not verifiable.
An invented story, theory, or concept.
examples: His story is a pure myth .

main_definition: A traditional story which embodies a belief regarding some fact or phenomenon of experience, and in which often the forces of nature and of the soul are personified ; a sacred narrative regarding a god , a hero, the origin of the world or of a people, etc.
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) Such stories as a genre.
A commonly-held but false belief , a common misconception ; a fictitious or imaginary person or thing; a popular conception about a real person or event which exaggerates or idealizes reality.
A person or thing held in excessive or quasi-religious awe or admiration based on popular legend
A person or thing existing only in imagination, or whose actual existence is not verifiable.
An invented story, theory, or concept.
